translated: Thus, in the Samdhinirmocana and other sutras, the Lord has taught the various kinds of focusing for yogis, by way of the eighteen kinds of emptiness, etc.

translated: Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn, in order to benefit all sentient beings, taught in the Abhidharma and so on the classification of things in brief, intermediate, and extensive forms, with distinctions such as those that are material and those that are not.

analyzed: de yang dngos po la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba spang ba'i phyir phung po dang khams la sogs par bsdus pa'i sgo nas bgrang ngo //
translated: Moreover, in order to abandon superimposition and denial regarding things, he enumerated them in terms of their inclusion in the aggregates, constituents, and so on.

analyzed: de nas dngos po thams cad bsdus pa'i bye brag phyed nas de nyid @31b la sems yang dang yang rgyun du 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Then, having distinguished the categories that include all things, one should repeatedly and continuously direct the mind to that.

analyzed: gang gi tshe bar skabs su 'dod chags la sogs pas sems phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa de'i tshe rnam par g-yeng bar shes par byas la mi sdug pa la sogs pa bsgoms pas rnam par g-yeng ba zhi bar byas shing myur du de nyid
translated: When your mind is distracted by attachment and so on, recognize that you are distracted and then quickly return to your original object of meditation.üîΩ

translated: When one sees that one is not pleased with the object, then, by seeing the virtues of samadhi, one cultivates pleasure in it, and by seeing the faults of distraction, one pacifies displeasure.

analyzed: rtse gcig tu byed do //

translated: To pacify means to generate joy.üîΩTo completely pacify means to completely pacify the absence of joy that results from seeing the faults of distraction.

translated: To refine means to eliminate the faults of lethargy and sleepiness.

analyzed: rtse gcig tu byed pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pas 'jug par 'bad par byed pa'o //
translated: To unify means to strive to enter the meditative state without the application of effort.

analyzed: mnyam par 'jog ces bya ba ni sems mnyam par gyur pa na btang snyoms su byed pa ste /
translated: Equanimity means that when the mind has become balanced, one should remain in equanimity.

analyzed: mdor na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi nyes pa drug yod de /

analyzed: le lo dang / dmigs pa brjed pa dang / bying ba dang / rgod pa dang / mi rtsol ba dang / rtsol ba'o //
translated: Laziness, forgetting the instructions, laxity and excitement, lack of application, and application.

analyzed: de rnams kyi gnyen por spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad bsgom mo /
translated: The eight formative factors that are the remedies for these are cultivated.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dad pa dang / 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms so //
translated: Faith, aspiration, effort, pliancy, mindfulness, alertness, intention, and equanimity.

original: de la gong ma bzhi ni le lo'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: de la gong ma bzhi ni le lo'i gnyen po ste /
translated: Among these, the first four are the remedies for laziness.

original: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan dag la mngon par yid ches pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i dad pa rnal 'byor pa rnams de la 'dod pa skye'o //

translated: Thus, the yogis and yoginis who have faith, which has the characteristic of clear conviction in the virtues of meditative concentration, develop a desire for it.

original: de nas 'dod pas brtson 'grus rtsom mo /
analyzed: de nas 'dod pas brtson 'grus rtsom mo /
translated: Then, because of that desire, they make an effort.

analyzed: de brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis lus dang sems las su rung ba nyid byed do //
translated: Through the power of that effort, they make the mind and body fit and ready for use.

original: de nas lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs par gyur pas le lo ldog ste /
analyzed: de nas lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs par gyur pas le lo ldog ste /
translated: Then, because the mind and body have become fit and ready, laziness is eliminated.

original: de bas na dad pa la sogs pa ni le lo spang ba'i phyir bsgom mo //
analyzed: de bas na dad pa la sogs pa ni le lo spang ba'i phyir bsgom mo //
translated: Therefore, faith and the other mental factors are cultivated in order to eliminate laziness.

original: dran pa ni dmigs pa brjed pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: dran pa ni dmigs pa brjed pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: Mindfulness is the antidote to forgetting the instructions.

original: shes bzhin ni bying ba dang rgod pa'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: shes bzhin ni bying ba dang rgod pa'i gnyen po ste /
translated: Alertness is the antidote to laxity and excitement.

original: des bying ba dang rgod pa yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bying ba dang rgod pa yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it correctly recognizes laxity and excitement.

original: bying ba dang rgod pa rab tu ma zhi ba'i dus na mi rtsol ba nyes pa ste /
analyzed: bying ba dang rgod pa rab tu ma zhi ba'i dus na mi rtsol ba nyes pa ste /

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don rnam par 'jig pa na shes pa'i snang ba cung zad gsal ba byung ba de'i tshe nges par 'byed pa'i @39b cha dang mthun pa dro bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don rnam par 'jig pa na shes pa'i snang ba cung zad gsal ba byung ba de'i tshe nges par 'byed pa'i @39b cha dang mthun pa dro bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when external objects are destroyed, if the appearance of consciousness arises slightly clearly, then it is the heat stage that is conducive to penetration.

original: de ni theg pa chen po 'dir snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni theg pa chen po 'dir snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the samƒÅdhi of attaining light in this Great Vehicle.

original: gang gi tshe shes pa'i snang ba de nyid 'bring tsam du gsal bar gyur pa de'i tshe nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rtse mo zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes pa'i snang ba de nyid 'bring tsam du gsal bar gyur pa de'i tshe nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rtse mo zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: When that appearance of consciousness becomes slightly clearer, then it is the peak stage that is conducive to penetration.

original: snang ba mchod pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes kyang bya'o//
analyzed: snang ba mchod pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes kyang bya'o//
translated: It is also called the samƒÅdhi of increasing light.

original: gang gi tshe de nyid tshes gsal bar gyur te phyi rol gyi don mi snang ba'i shes pa'i snang ba byung ba de'i tshe rnam par shes pa tsam la gnas pa'i phyir nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzod pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de nyid tshes gsal bar gyur te phyi rol gyi don mi snang ba'i shes pa'i snang ba byung ba de'i tshe rnam par shes pa tsam la gnas pa'i phyir nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzod pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: When that very [appearance of consciousness] becomes clearer and the appearance of consciousness arises without the appearance of external objects, then it is the acceptance stage that is conducive to penetration, because one abides in mere consciousness.

original: phyogs gcig la zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: phyogs gcig la zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called the concentration of one-pointedness,

original: gzung ba'i rnam pa mi dmigs par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa mi dmigs par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is directed toward the non-perception of the aspect of the object.

original: gang gi tshe 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang gnyis su med pa'i shes pa yang rnam par 'jig pa de'i tshe nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa chos kyi mchog ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang gnyis su med pa'i shes pa yang rnam par 'jig pa de'i tshe nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa chos kyi mchog ces bya ba yin no //
translated: When the cognition that is not differentiated as subject and object is also destroyed, then it is called the supreme mundane state, which is conducive to penetration.

original: de ma thag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called the concentration of the threshold,

original: de ma thag kho nar de kho na la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma thag kho nar de kho na la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is directed toward reality itself immediately after that.

original: de'i bar du ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bar du ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa yin no //
translated: The stage of action in faith is up to that point.

original: sa gzhan dag ni mdor na yan lag bcu gcig yongs su rdzogs pa'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sa gzhan dag ni mdor na yan lag bcu gcig yongs su rdzogs pa'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The other stages are established in brief by the completion of eleven members.

original: de las dang por ni thog mar gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i de kho na rtogs pa'i yan lag yongs su rdzogs pa las rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de las dang por ni thog mar gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i de kho na rtogs pa'i yan lag yongs su rdzogs pa las rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: First of all, it is established by the completion of the member that is the realization of reality, which is the selflessness of the person and of the dharmas.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe chos kyi mchog gi mjug thogs kho nar chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par mngon sum du byed pa'i ye shes shin tu gsal ba 'jig rten las 'das pa spros pa thams cad dang bral ba thog ma byung ba de'i tshe byang
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe chos kyi mchog gi mjug thogs kho nar chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par mngon sum du byed pa'i ye shes shin tu gsal ba 'jig rten las 'das pa spros pa thams cad dang bral ba thog ma byung ba de'i tshe byang
translated: Thus, when the knowledge that directly realizes that all phenomena are essenceless arises for the first time, it is extremely clear, it is supramundane, and it is free from all elaborations.

original: chub sems dpa' yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la zhugs pas mthong ba'i lam skyes pa'i phyir sa dang por chud pa yin no //üîΩde bas na de kho na khong du ma chud pas 'di la thog mar khong du chud pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba yin te /
analyzed: chub sems dpa' yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la zhugs pas mthong ba'i lam skyes pa'i phyir sa dang por chud pa yin no // de bas na de kho na khong du ma chud pas 'di la thog mar khong du chud pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba yin te /
translated: At that time, the bodhisattva enters the faultless state of reality, and because the path of seeing has arisen, he enters the first ground.

original: des na sa de rab tu dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na sa de rab tu dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because he has not previously understood reality, he first understands it on this ground, and so it is called the bodhisattva ground Very Joyful.

original: sa der mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa bcu gnyis spong ngo //
analyzed: sa der mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa bcu gnyis spong ngo //
translated: On this ground, he abandons the one hundred and twelve afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: sa lhag ma rnams ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: sa lhag ma rnams ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The remaining grounds are the nature of the path of meditation.

original: de dag tu bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa bcu drug spong ngo //
analyzed: de dag tu bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa bcu drug spong ngo //
translated: By cultivating these, one abandons the sixteen afflictions of the three realms that are to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: sa der byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba nyid rtogs pas bdag gi don dang 'dra bar gzhan gyi @40a * //
analyzed: sa der byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba nyid rtogs pas bdag gi don dang 'dra bar gzhan gyi @40a * //
translated: On this stage, the bodhisattva, by realizing the all-pervading nature of the realm of the Dharma, engages in the welfare of others as if it were his own welfare.

original: don la 'jug pa'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu shas che ba yin no //
analyzed: don la 'jug pa'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu shas che ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of generosity is predominant on this stage.

original: byang chub sems dpa' des de kho na khong du chud kyang ji srid du lhung ba'i 'khrul pa cha phra ba rnams la shes bzhin du gnas par byed mi nus pa de srid du sa dang po'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' des de kho na khong du chud kyang ji srid du lhung ba'i 'khrul pa cha phra ba rnams la shes bzhin du gnas par byed mi nus pa de srid du sa dang po'o //
translated: As long as the bodhisattva, although he has realized reality, is not able to abide in full awareness of the subtle errors that cause him to fall, he is on the first stage.

original: gang gi tshe nus pa de'i yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pas sa gnyis par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nus pa de'i yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pas sa gnyis par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: When he is able to do so, that factor being perfected, he is on the second stage.

original: de bas na sa de la ltung ba'i 'khrul pa cha phra ba kun tu mi spyod pas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu shas che ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sa de la ltung ba'i 'khrul pa cha phra ba kun tu mi spyod pas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu shas che ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, on this stage, the perfection of morality is predominant, since he does not engage in even the most subtle errors that cause him to fall.

original: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir sa de dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir sa de dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is free from all stains of immorality, this stage is called the Stainless.

original: ltung ba'i 'khrul pa cha phra ba rnams la shes bzhin du gnas pa yang yin no //
analyzed: ltung ba'i 'khrul pa cha phra ba rnams la shes bzhin du gnas pa yang yin no //
translated: And he is also one who abides in full awareness of even the most subtle transgressions.

original: ji srid du 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin mtha' dag la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / ji skad thos pa'i don kun tu 'dzin mi nus pa de srid du sa gnyis pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ji srid du 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin mtha' dag la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / ji skad thos pa'i don kun tu 'dzin mi nus pa de srid du sa gnyis pa kho na'o //
translated: As long as he is not able to enter into all the worldly meditative concentrations and meditative attainments and to retain the meaning of what he has heard, he remains on the second stage.

original: gang gi tshe nus pa de'i tshe yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pas sa gsum par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nus pa de'i tshe yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pas sa gsum par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: But when he is able, then that factor is complete, and he is posited as being on the third stage.

original: sa de la byang chub sems dpa' thos pa gzung ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad mngon par sgrub pa'i phyir sdug bsngal thams cad bzod pas na bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu shas che ba yin no //
analyzed: sa de la byang chub sems dpa' thos pa gzung ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad mngon par sgrub pa'i phyir sdug bsngal thams cad bzod pas na bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu shas che ba yin no //
translated: On this stage, the bodhisattva has a preponderance of the perfection of patience, because he is patient with all the sufferings that occur in order to retain what he has heard and to accomplish all the worldly meditative concentrations and meditative attainments.

original: ting nge 'dzin de dag thob pas sa de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba tshad med pa byed pas 'od byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de dag thob pas sa de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba tshad med pa byed pas 'od byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since one has attained those meditative concentrations, this stage is called the ‚Äúilluminating‚Äù stage because it creates the limitless light of supramundane intuition.

original: de 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin mtha' dag thob kyang ji srid du ji ltar thob pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis lan mang du gnas par byed pa dang / chos dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems btang snyoms su byed mi nus pa de srid du sa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin mtha' dag thob kyang ji srid du ji ltar thob pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis lan mang du gnas par byed pa dang / chos dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems btang snyoms su byed mi nus pa de srid du sa gsum pa'o //
translated: Even though one has attained all mundane meditative concentrations, as long as one is not able to abide frequently in the factors contributing to enlightenment as they have been attained, and to be indifferent to the mind in meditative concentration on the teaching, that is the third stage.

original: gang gi tshe nus pa de'i tshe yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pas sa bzhi bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nus pa de'i tshe yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pas sa bzhi bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: But when one is able, then that factor is complete, and the fourth stage is established.

original: sa de la byang chub sems dpa' rgyun mi 'chad par ngag dang yid kyi brjod pa las yang dag par bzla ba'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis gnas pas na brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu shas che ba yin no //
analyzed: sa de la byang chub sems dpa' rgyun mi 'chad par ngag dang yid kyi brjod pa las yang dag par bzla ba'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis gnas pas na brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu shas che ba yin no //
translated: On this spiritual level, the bodhisattva is firmly established in the factors of enlightenment because he is constantly engaged in transcending verbal and mental expression, and thus the perfection of effort predominates.

original: sa de ni nyon mongs pa'i shing mtha' dag sreg par nus pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi 'od 'phro ba shin tu byung bas 'od 'phro ba can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa de ni nyon mongs pa'i shing mtha' dag sreg par nus pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi 'od 'phro ba shin tu byung bas 'od 'phro ba can zhes bya'o //
translated: This spiritual level is called the luminous because the light of the factors of enlightenment which is capable of burning all the trees of the afflictions becomes very evident.

original: de byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos @40b gyis rgyun mi 'chad par gnas pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos @40b gyis rgyun mi 'chad par gnas pa yang yin no //
translated: And he is constantly engaged in the factors of enlightenment.

original: ji srid du bden pa rnams bsgom pa na 'khor ba la mi phyogs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du phyogs pa las sems bzlog ste /
analyzed: ji srid du bden pa rnams bsgom pa na 'khor ba la mi phyogs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du phyogs pa las sems bzlog ste /
translated: As long as he is unable to turn his mind away from the inclination towards samsara and towards nirvana while cultivating the truths,

original: thabs kyis zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom mi nus pa de srid du sa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: thabs kyis zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom mi nus pa de srid du sa bzhi pa'o //
translated: and as long as he is unable to cultivate the factors of enlightenment which are embraced by the means, this is the fourth spiritual level.

original: gang gi tshe nus pa de'i tshe yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pas sa lnga par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nus pa de'i tshe yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pas sa lnga par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: When it is able to do so, then that part is complete, and it is posited as the fifth stage.

original: de bas na sa de la thabs kyis zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa de yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni shin tu sbyang bar dka' bas na shin tu sbyang dka' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sa de la thabs kyis zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa de yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni shin tu sbyang bar dka' bas na shin tu sbyang dka' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, on that stage, the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment, which is supported by the means, is completed, and it is called Difficult to Master because it is difficult to master.

original: sa de la bden pa'i rnam pa sgom pa lan mang du byed pas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu shas che ba yin te /
analyzed: sa de la bden pa'i rnam pa sgom pa lan mang du byed pas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu shas che ba yin te /
translated: On that stage, the perfection of meditation is very great, because one cultivates the aspects of the truths many times.

original: de thabs kyis zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyis lan mang du gnas pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de thabs kyis zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyis lan mang du gnas pa yang yin no //
translated: And one also abides many times in the factors of enlightenment, which are supported by the means.

original: ji srid du 'khor bar 'jug pa la so sor rtog pas skyo ba dang ldan pas sems kyi rgyud kyis mtshan ma med par gnas pa la mnyam par 'jog mi nus pa de srid du sa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du 'khor bar 'jug pa la so sor rtog pas skyo ba dang ldan pas sems kyi rgyud kyis mtshan ma med par gnas pa la mnyam par 'jog mi nus pa de srid du sa lnga pa'o //
translated: As long as one is not able to rest in equipoise in the signless abiding of the mind-continuum, because one is weary of discerning the entry into cyclic existence, that is the fifth stage.

original: gang gi tshe nus pa de'i tshe yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pas sa drug pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nus pa de'i tshe yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pas sa drug pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: When he is able to do this, then that factor being completed, the sixth spiritual level is attained.

original: sa de la byang chub sems dpa' rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sgom pas gnas pas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu shas che ba yin no //
analyzed: sa de la byang chub sems dpa' rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sgom pas gnas pas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu shas che ba yin no //
translated: On this spiritual level, the bodhisattva, by virtue of his meditative practice of dependent origination, has a predominance of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu shas che ba'i phyir sa de la sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon du gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu shas che ba'i phyir sa de la sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon du gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because of the predominance of the perfection of wisdom, this spiritual level is called the Manifest.

original: de mtshan ma med par gnas pa thob pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de mtshan ma med par gnas pa thob pa yang yin no //
translated: He also attains the state of signlessness.

original: ji srid du skabs med par mtshan ma med par gnas pa la mnyam par 'jog mi nus pa de srid du sa drug pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du skabs med par mtshan ma med par gnas pa la mnyam par 'jog mi nus pa de srid du sa drug pa'o //
translated: As long as he is unable to enter into the state of signlessness without interval, for that long it is the sixth spiritual level.

original: gang gi tshe nus pa de'i tshe yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pas sa bdun par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nus pa de'i tshe yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pas sa bdun par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: When he is able to do this, then that factor being completed, the seventh spiritual level is attained.

original: sa de la byang chub sems dpa' mtshan ma thams cad mtshan ma med par khong du chud la mtshan mar byas pa'i tha snyad kyang 'gog par mi byed do //
analyzed: sa de la byang chub sems dpa' mtshan ma thams cad mtshan ma med par khong du chud la mtshan mar byas pa'i tha snyad kyang 'gog par mi byed do //
translated: On this spiritual level, the Bodhisattva has realized that all signs are signless, but he does not stop the conventional usage of signs.

original: de bas na sa de la thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu shas che ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sa de la thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu shas che ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, on this spiritual level, the perfection of means is exceedingly great.

original: sa 'di lhun gyis grub pa'i lam dang 'brel pa'i phyir shin tu ring du song bas ring du song ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa 'di lhun gyis grub pa'i lam dang 'brel pa'i phyir shin tu ring du song bas ring du song ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This spiritual level is called Gone Afar because it is connected with the path of spontaneity and because it has gone a long way.

original: de skabs med pa mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa yang yin no //üîΩde ji srid du lhun gyis grub pas 'jug pa'i mtshan ma med par @41a * //
analyzed: de skabs med pa mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa yang yin no // de ji srid du lhun gyis grub pas 'jug pa'i mtshan ma med par @41a * //
translated: He also abides in signlessness, which is not an opportunity for signs.

original: gnas pa la mnyam par 'jog mi nus pa de srid dus bdun pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa la mnyam par 'jog mi nus pa de srid dus bdun pa'o //
translated: As long as he is not able to rest in the signless concentration of mind through spontaneity, it is the seventh spiritual level.

original: gang gi tshe nus pa de'i tshe yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pas sa brgyad par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nus pa de'i tshe yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pas sa brgyad par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: When he is able, that factor is fulfilled and he is situated on the eighth spiritual level.

original: sa de la lhun gyis grub par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bas na smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu shas che ba yin no //
analyzed: sa de la lhun gyis grub par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bas na smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu shas che ba yin no //
translated: Since in this stage one is spontaneously born in the virtuous side, the perfection of vows is extremely abundant.

original: mtshan ma med pa la rtsol bas mi bskyod pa'i phyir de mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la rtsol bas mi bskyod pa'i phyir de mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called Immovable because it is unshakable by the signless, since one strives for the signless.

original: de lhun gyis grub par mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de lhun gyis grub par mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa yang yin no //
translated: And one is spontaneously born in the signless.

original: ji srid du rnam grangs dang / nges pa'i tshig la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye bas rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa la dbang bsgyur bar mi nus pa de srid du sa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du rnam grangs dang / nges pa'i tshig la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye bas rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa la dbang bsgyur bar mi nus pa de srid du sa brgyad pa'o //
translated: As long as one is unable to control the teaching of the Dharma in all its aspects by means of the categories of synonyms, etymologies, and so on, one is on the eighth stage.

original: gang gi tshe nus pa de'i tshe yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pas sa dgu par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nus pa de'i tshe yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pas sa dgu par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: When one is able, then that factor is complete, and one is established in the ninth stage.

original: sa de la byang chub sems dpa' so so yang dag par rig pa'i khyad par thob pas shes rab kyi stobs kyi khyad par dang ldan pas na stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu shas che ba yin no //
analyzed: sa de la byang chub sems dpa' so so yang dag par rig pa'i khyad par thob pas shes rab kyi stobs kyi khyad par dang ldan pas na stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu shas che ba yin no //
translated: On this spiritual level, the bodhisattva, having attained the special knowledge, possesses the special power of wisdom, hence, the perfection of power is predominant.

original: rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa la mkhas pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa'i blo gros kyi khyad par thob pa'i phyir legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa la mkhas pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa'i blo gros kyi khyad par thob pa'i phyir legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called Good Discernment because he attains the special, irreproachable discernment of intelligence through his skill in teaching the Dharma in all its aspects.

original: de so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pa yang yin no //
translated: He also attains the four special knowledges.

original: ji srid du sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / 'khor dang / sprul pa la sogs pa bstan pa dang / chos yongs su rdzogs par longs spyad pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed mi nus pa de srid du sa dgu pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / 'khor dang / sprul pa la sogs pa bstan pa dang / chos yongs su rdzogs par longs spyad pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed mi nus pa de srid du sa dgu pa'o //
translated: As long as he is unable to manifest a buddha-field, a retinue, emanations, etc., to enjoy the complete enjoyment of the Dharma, and to bring beings to full maturity, he is on the ninth spiritual level.

original: gang gi tshe nus pa de'i tshe yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pas sa bcu par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nus pa de'i tshe yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pas sa bcu par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: When he is able, then, because that factor is fulfilled, he is on the tenth spiritual level.

original: de la sprul pa la sogs pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la mkhas pa'i khyad par dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu shas che ba yin no //
analyzed: de la sprul pa la sogs pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la mkhas pa'i khyad par dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu shas che ba yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is preeminent in the perfection of wisdom, because he is endowed with the special skill in ripening beings through emanations and so forth.

original: de ni chos ston pa'i sprin rnams kyis 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa rnams su chos kyi char 'bebs pas na chos kyi sprin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni chos ston pa'i sprin rnams kyis 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa rnams su chos kyi char 'bebs pas na chos kyi sprin zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called the Cloud of Dharma because he rains down the rain of Dharma in limitless world systems through the clouds of Dharma teaching.

original: gzhan yang phung po yongs su dag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa rnams kyis sa rnam par gzhag pa yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang phung po yongs su dag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa rnams kyis sa rnam par gzhag pa yod de /
translated: Moreover, the stages are established by the arrangement of the completely pure aggregates and so forth.

original: yi ge mangs kyis dogs nas ma bris so //
analyzed: yi ge mangs kyis dogs nas ma bris so //
translated: Fearing too many words, I will not write more.

original: des sprul pa la sogs pa'i dbang thob kyang ji srid du shes bya thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i ye shes bskyed @41b par mi nus pa de srid du sa bcu pa'o //
analyzed: des sprul pa la sogs pa'i dbang thob kyang ji srid du shes bya thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i ye shes bskyed @41b par mi nus pa de srid du sa bcu pa'o //
translated: Even though he obtains control over emanations and so forth, as long as he is unable to generate the wisdom that is unimpeded and unattached to all objects of knowledge in all aspects, that is the tenth stage.

original: gang gi tshe nus pa de'i tshe yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pas sangs rgyas kyi sar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nus pa de'i tshe yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pas sangs rgyas kyi sar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: When it is able to do so, that stage is complete and is posited as the buddha stage.

original: sa rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las bstan to //
analyzed: sa rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las bstan to //
translated: This presentation of the stages is taught in the noble Unraveling the Intent.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa 'di ni phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa thams cad mtha' dag rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i phyir 'di las gong na rnam pa gzhan med pas de phan chad sa rnam par gzhag pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa 'di ni phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa thams cad mtha' dag rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i phyir 'di las gong na rnam pa gzhan med pas de phan chad sa rnam par gzhag pa med do //
translated: Since this buddha stage is the culmination of the perfection of all aspects of excellence to the highest degree, there is no other aspect beyond it, and therefore there is no further presentation of stages beyond it.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa de'i yon tan gyi phyogs rab tu dbye ba dpag tu med pas rnam pa thams cad brjod pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang mi spyod na bdag 'dra bas lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa de'i yon tan gyi phyogs rab tu dbye ba dpag tu med pas rnam pa thams cad brjod pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang mi spyod na bdag 'dra bas lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: Since the qualities of that buddha stage are classified into an immeasurable number of categories, it is impossible to describe all of them even by the buddhas, let alone by someone like me.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las kyang /
translated: In the noble Array of Stalks,

original: shin tu brtags kyang rang byung gi //
analyzed: shin tu brtags kyang rang byung gi //
translated: Even if one were to examine them,

original: yon tan rnams kyi phyogs gcig mtha' //
analyzed: yon tan rnams kyi phyogs gcig mtha' //
translated: The limits of the qualities of the self-arisen

original: mi rtog sangs rgyas rnams dang ni //
analyzed: mi rtog sangs rgyas rnams dang ni //
translated: The Buddhas, who are free from conceptualization,

original: chos rnams bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: chos rnams bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: and the inconceivable Dharmas.

original: zhes bka' stsal pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bka' stsal pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is what the Lord has said.

original: mdor 'di tsam zhig brjod par nus te /
analyzed: mdor 'di tsam zhig brjod par nus te /
translated: This much can be said in brief:

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa nyes pa ma lus pa bsal ba'i mthar thug pa brnyes nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams chos kyi sku la bzhugs te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa nyes pa ma lus pa bsal ba'i mthar thug pa brnyes nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams chos kyi sku la bzhugs te /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas, having attained the perfection of the fulfillment of their own and others' aims, having attained the ultimate elimination of all faults, abide in the Dharma Body.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i skus 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don lhun gyis grub pa'i tshul gyis mdzad cing 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs so //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i skus 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don lhun gyis grub pa'i tshul gyis mdzad cing 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs so //
translated: And by means of the Enjoyment and Transformation Bodies, they perform benefit for all beings in a spontaneous way, and they abide as long as the world endures.

original: de lta bas na rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis yon tan thams cad kyi 'byung gnas bcom ldan 'das rnams la dad pa bskyed la de dag gi yon tan yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad kyis rab tu 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis yon tan thams cad kyi 'byung gnas bcom ldan 'das rnams la dad pa bskyed la de dag gi yon tan yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad kyis rab tu 'bad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those who are intelligent should generate faith in the Blessed Buddhas, the source of all good qualities, and they should strive in every way to attain those good qualities.

original: sku gsum la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba ni yi ge mangs kyis dogs te ma bris so //üîΩmdo sde dag gi tshul gyis lugs mthun pa //
analyzed: sku gsum la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba ni yi ge mangs kyis dogs te ma bris so // mdo sde dag gi tshul gyis lugs mthun pa //
translated: The divisions of the three bodies and so forth are not written about here for fear of being too wordy.üîΩThis path of the bodhisattvas,üîΩtaught in accordance with the sutras,

original: rgyal ba'i sras kyi lam 'di legs bshad pas //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras kyi lam 'di legs bshad pas //
translated: has been well explained by me.

original: bdag gis bsod nams mi chung gang thob des //
analyzed: bdag gis bsod nams mi chung gang thob des //
translated: By whatever merit I have gained from this,üîΩmay the world, whose intelligence is weak, quickly attain the highest mind.

original: 'gro ba shes zhan blo mchog myur thob shog / sa'i mnga' bdag dpal lha btsan pos bka' stsal nas ka ma la sh'i las bsgom pa'i rim pa mdor bsdus pa 'di bgyis so //
analyzed: 'gro ba shes zhan blo mchog myur thob shog / sa'i mnga' bdag dpal lha btsan pos bka' stsal nas ka ma la sh'i las bsgom pa'i rim pa mdor bsdus pa 'di bgyis so //
translated: This brief exposition of the stages of meditation was composed by the king of Kamalasri at the command of the lord of the land, the glorious Lha btsan po.

original: bsgom rim dang po rdzogs so /
analyzed: bsgom rim dang po rdzogs so /
translated: The first Stages of Meditation is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po pradzny'a warma dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande ye shes sde la sogs pas bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po pradzny'a warma dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande ye shes sde la sogs pas bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
translated: The Indian abbot Prajnavardhana and the great editor and translator Bandhe Yeshe De and others translated and edited this text.
